body: For yii3, consider whether it makes sense to support the current php output format (`{"date":"2019-12-23 15:52:27.717576","timezone_type":3,"timezone":"UTC"}`). I prefer unix timestamp (eliminate timezone), or [RFC3339#5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6) format [`Y-m-d\TH:i:s.vP`](https://www.php.net/manual/en/class.datetimeinterface.php#datetime.constants.rfc3339_extended)

Well, it works as expected on php `7.2` and `7.3` but I can stably reproduce issue on `7.4.0` and `7.4.1`

For checking this issue I used Docker and php tags `php:7.2-fpm`, `php:7.3-fpm`, `php:7.4-fpm`, `php:7.4.1-fpm`

I can confirm this issue - it was changed in PHP 7.4. It seems that `DateTime` is somewhat hacky, since it should not contain public properties, and `json_encode()` is treated specially for BC reasons. It was already fixed for array cast: https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=78383

But foreach behavior is still inconsistent: https://3v4l.org/h99LLn
Could we cast to array in `foreach` [BaseJson.php#L162](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/helpers/BaseJson.php#L162)?

Cast to array exposes also private and protected properties - it would be easier to add special condition for `DateTime`. But I would try to report it as PHP bug, since current behavior for `DateTime` is weird and inconsistent.
@rob006 would you please report a PHP bug?
Seems to unlikely being fixed on the PHP side.

issue.title: Fix #17760: Fix `JSON::encode()` for `\DateTimeInterface` under PHP 7.4

issue.title: Opening Hours aren't saved anymore

labels.name: need info
labels.description: Need more information on the issue

repository.name: craft-seomatic
repository.description: SEOmatic facilitates modern SEO best practices & implementation for Craft CMS 3. It is a turnkey SEO system that is comprehensive, powerful, and flexible.

issue.body:
Since updating to `3.2.38`, the opening hours under `/admin/seomatic/site/identity/default` aren't saved anymore. You can still select them, but after the page refresh the values are gone. This might happen because of a JS error that occurs as well:

```js
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'value' of null
    at Module.52 (seomatic-tokens.js:23)
    at a (bootstrap:79)
    at r (bootstrap:45)
    at bootstrap:152
    at seomatic-tokens.js:9
```

In the 3.2.38 release, that file was changed at those lines.
